runs.planned: Rest Day. Focus on recovery after yesterday's quality session. Optional light stretching or yoga.
Easy Run 7km at 6:30-7:00/km pace. This is a step-back week, so focus on relaxed, comfortable running. Monitor how your body is responding to the increased training load of recent weeks.

Long Run 18km at 6:15-6:45/km pace. Keep effort comfortable with no structured pace work this week. This reduced long run allows recovery while maintaining endurance. Focus on good form throughout. Take water as needed - continue practicing your hydration strategy even on easier weeks.
Rest Day. Focus on recovery, hydration and good nutrition. Optional light mobility work to keep muscles loose.

Easy Run 7km at 6:30-7:00/km pace. Keep effort very relaxed. Consider tracking morning heart rate this week to establish your normal baseline - this can help identify early signs of overtraining in more intense training weeks ahead.

Marathon Pace Session: Total 9km as follows: 2km warmup, 5km at marathon pace (6:10-6:20/km), 2km cooldown. The focus is on maintaining perfect marathon pace - you should finish feeling like you could have run much further at this pace. This is a confidence-building session to practice race pace before moving to the Peak Phase of training.

Medium-Long Run 12km at 6:30-6:45/km pace. Moderate hills, focus on form rather than speed. This is a reduction in distance from previous weeks to allow recovery before entering the Peak Phase. Pay attention to how your body feels on hills after several weeks of hill-focused training.
